Onions contain organic sulfur compounds. Organic sulfur compounds reduce the level of cholesterol and break down blood clots, lowering your risk for heart disease and stroke.
details.header: Lower Risk of Heart Disease and Stroke

details.full_description: Quercetin and organic sulfur compounds in onions are known to promote insulin production, making them a helpful vegetable choice for those with diabetes

Onions are full of antioxidants. The essential flavonoid "Quercetin" is abundant in all onions. Antioxidant polyphenol Is found in the outer layers of the onion.

Some experts believe that quercetin from onions is absorbed much better by the body than from dietary supplements.

In addition to reducing free radicals, the active ingredients in onion also develop anti-allergic properties. These effects occur through the stimulation of the immune system, antiviral activities, reduction of proinflammatory cytokines, or histamine release.

Cancer-fighting properties are linked to the sulfur compounds and flavonoid antioxidants found in allium vegetables.

Onions also contain fisetin and quercetin, flavonoid antioxidants that may inhibit tumor growth.

Onions are a rich source of fiber and prebiotics, which are really needed for gut health. Onions are very rich in the prebiotics inulin and fructooligosaccharides.

Research has shown that these short-chain fatty acids strengthen gut health, boost immunity, reduce inflammation and enhance digestion.
